text: my name is miriana jerema and i am an
aws solutions architect i've been aws
for a little over 18 months before aws i
worked as a solution acted for about six
years
and then i moved on to a role as an
application operations engineer and i
got promoted to a
a manager and then i started losing my
my technical skills
so i decided to go back into
architecting so that's why i joined aws
after that
for me i think the biggest difference
between being a solution architect at
other organizations versus aws is the
difference in challenge for example as
an essay i i just had to know my tech
stack and basically would prefer what
solutions are best for the organization
or for the business but with aws you're
not just preferring solutions you are
constantly
reinventing thinking about how to make
even that great solution even a better
design
with aws it's constantly evolving and
you get heard you get to actually
implement what you're thinking and and
that's that's the part of the culture
that i enjoy just the ability to test
and fail fast to be able to make
mistakes and learn from that and and do
it right the next time when i was at
other organizations i would never have
done that
some people out there might feel
intimidated or overwhelmed just because
the depth and breadth of knowledge
within aws is overwhelming no matter how
tech savvy you are no matter how
advanced you are you're still going to
come into this wealth of knowledge that
you're going to be swimming in but the
truth is there's a lot of helping hands
here at aws the culture promotes those
helping hands to help pull you up and
make you a better solution architect and
not just an sa but an aws employee in
general it's a great opportunity to
to join aws and i would say if you are
thinking about it this is the right time
to do it be a part of the builders
community be a part of the future
